title: Democracy linked to global health gains in low-, middle-income countries

title_detail.value: Democracy linked to global health gains in low-, middle-income countries

summary: A new study suggests that a better way to measure the role of democracy in public health is to examine the causes of adult mortality, such as noncommunicable diseases, HIV, cardiovascular disease and transportation injuries. Little international assistance targets these noncommunicable diseases.
